metadata.dc:author: Quero, J
Martínez Ferrer, M
Salas, S
Barrio Andrés, M C
Ruiz, A
Hawkins, F
metadata.dc:description: The present case report concerns a term infant, born of a mother with an undiagnosed tuberculosis, which was proved by inguinal lymph node biopsy to have numerous acid-fast bacilli; sequence of events supports the thesis that infant had acquired infection transplacentally. Literature is reviewed and diagnosis, prophylaxis, chemotherapy of this infrequent disease with a grave prognosis is commented, emphasizing success of chemotherapy in this infant.
metadata.dc:title: Tuberculosis congénita. Un caso de buena evolución.
[Congenital tuberculosis (author's transl)].
